value.title: Implement and manage storage for Azure administrators
value.excerpt: Learn how to manage storage as an Azure administrators.

topItems.title: Create an Azure Storage account
topItems.excerpt: Discover ways to use an Azure Storage account to manage your data for billing, access, and storage location of your blobs, files, queues, and tables.

topItems.title: Choose the right disk storage for your virtual machine workload
topItems.excerpt: Azure provides a variety of disk storage options for virtual machine workloads. Identify the features of capabilities of each type to ensure your application performs optimally.

topItems.title: Provide disaster recovery by replicating storage data across regions and failing over to secondary location
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to provide disaster recovery by replicating storage data across regions and failing over to secondary location.

topItems.title: Secure your Azure Storage account
topItems.excerpt: Learn how Azure Storage provides multilayered security to protect your data with access keys, secure networks, and Advanced Threat Protection monitoring.

value.title: Introduction to Kubernetes on Azure
value.excerpt: Learn about the basics of Docker containers, container orchestration with Kubernetes, and managed clusters on Azure Kubernetes Service.

topItems.title: Introduction to Docker containers
topItems.excerpt: Introduction to Docker containers

topItems.title: Introduction to Kubernetes
topItems.excerpt: Get acquainted with the Kubernetes open-source container-orchestration system for automating application deployment, scaling, and management.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure Kubernetes Service
topItems.excerpt: Get acquainted with the Azure Kubernetes open-source container-orchestration system for automating application deployment, scaling, and management.

topItems.title: Deploy a containerized application on Azure Kubernetes Service
topItems.excerpt: Explore how to create and deploy a containerized application by using Azure Kubernetes Service declarative manifest files.

value.title: Monitor and back up resources for Azure administrators
value.excerpt: Learn how to monitor and back up Azure resources.

topItems.title: Design a holistic monitoring strategy on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Use monitoring services on Azure to bring operational excellence to your applications and infrastructure.

topItems.title: Monitor the health of your Azure virtual machine by using Azure Metrics Explorer and metric alerts
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to monitor the health of your Azure VMs by using Azure Metrics Explorer and metric alerts.

topItems.title: Analyze your Azure infrastructure by using Azure Monitor logs
topItems.excerpt: Use Azure Monitor logs to extract valuable information about your infrastructure from log data.

topItems.title: Monitor performance of virtual machines by using Azure Monitor for VMs
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use Azure Monitor for VMs to monitor your organization's Azure virtual machines.

value.title: Protect identity and access with Azure Active Directory
value.excerpt: The **Identity and Access learning path** covers the latest identity and access technologies, tools for strengthening authentication, and guidance on identity protection within your organization. Microsoft access and identity technologies enable you to secure your organization’s identity, whether it is on-premises or in the cloud, and empower your users to work securely from any location.

topItems.title: Define identity and access management in Azure Active Directory
topItems.excerpt: Learn about identity and access management in Azure Active Directory and why identity is a core component of your organization’s security posture.

topItems.title: Simplify access and identity provisioning with Azure Active Directory
topItems.excerpt: Learn about identity governance and how you can safeguard access to your organization’s data.

topItems.title: Strengthen authentication (conditional access) with Azure Active Directory
topItems.excerpt: Learn about modern authentication and the security benefits it provides to your organization, such as enabling multi-factor authentication and a passwordless environment.

topItems.title: Secure administrator accounts in Azure Active Directory
topItems.excerpt: Learn about securing administrator accounts through secure devices, dedicated administrator accounts, and just-in-time privileges.

value.title: Store data in Azure
value.excerpt: This learning path gets you started with the basics of storage management in Azure, Storage Account creation, and choices for data storage.

topItems.title: Choose a data storage approach in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn how using Azure Storage, Azure SQL Database, and Azure Cosmos DB - or a combination of them - for your business scenario is the best way to get the most performant solution.

topItems.title: Create an Azure Storage account
topItems.excerpt: Discover ways to use an Azure Storage account to manage your data for billing, access, and storage location of your blobs, files, queues, and tables.

topItems.title: Connect an app to Azure Storage
topItems.excerpt: Create a simple application and add configuration, client library references, and C# or JavaScript code to connect it to Azure Storage.

topItems.title: Secure your Azure Storage account
topItems.excerpt: Learn how Azure Storage provides multilayered security to protect your data with access keys, secure networks, and Advanced Threat Protection monitoring.

value.excerpt: Learn to develop an AI strategy to create value in government, including artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies, culture, and responsible AI.

topItems.title: Define an AI strategy to create business value
topItems.excerpt: Explore the strategic components, use cases, and special factors of an enterprise AI strategy that creates real business value, with INSEAD and Microsoft.

topItems.excerpt: Explore the strategic components, special factors, and use cases of an AI strategy in education that creates value, with INSEAD and Microsoft.

topItems.excerpt: Understand the key elements that make a culture AI-ready and a framework to drive the change needed in your organization for a successful AI strategy.

topItems.title: Discover how to foster an AI-ready culture in finance
topItems.excerpt: Learn the necessary cultural changes for enterprise finance organizations to make AI transformation successful, and how they fit into a holistic AI strategy.

value.title: Architect a data platform in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to architect a data platform in Azure and build solutions to store relational and NoSQL data.

topItems.title: Explore Azure database and analytics services
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the database services that are available on Microsoft Azure, such as Azure Cosmos DB, Azure SQL, Azure Database for MySQL, Azure Database for PostgreSQL, as well as big data and analytics.

topItems.title: Provision an Azure SQL database to store application data
topItems.excerpt: Find out what makes Azure SQL Database a good choice for your relational database, how to create the database from the portal and connect with Azure Cloud Shell.

topItems.title: Scale multiple Azure SQL Databases with SQL elastic pools
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create SQL elastic pools and how to use them to manage performance and cost for a collection of SQL databases.

topItems.title: Migrate your relational data stored in SQL Server to Azure SQL Database
topItems.excerpt: Plan and implement the migration of relational data from SQL Server to Azure SQL Database. Select the appropriate migration strategy for your database, and then use Data Migration Assistant to do the assessment and the migration.

value.title: Architect message brokering and serverless applications in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to create reliable messaging for your applications, and how to take advantage of serverless application services in Azure.

topItems.title: Create serverless logic with Azure Functions
topItems.excerpt: Azure Functions allow you to host business logic that can be executed without managing or provisioning server infrastructure

topItems.title: Route and process data automatically using Logic Apps
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to define a workflow to run your business with Logic apps using built-in triggers, actions, and conditional operators.

topItems.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services
topItems.excerpt: Learn how Azure's storage queues, event hubs, event grid, and service bus can improve your communication between devices.

topItems.title: Communicate between applications with Azure Queue storage
topItems.excerpt: Find out to use Azure Queue storage to handle high demand and improve resilience in your distributed applications.

value.title: Architect modern applications in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to build modern applications using PaaS services for applications, caching, containers and Kubernetes in Azure.

topItems.title: Build a containerized web application with Docker
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use Docker to build, store, and manage private container images with the Azure Container Registry.

topItems.title: Run Docker containers with Azure Container Instances
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to run and troubleshoot containerized apps using Docker containers with Azure Container Instances.

topItems.title: Build and store container images with Azure Container Registry
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use Docker to build, store, and manage private container images with the Azure Container Registry.

topItems.title: Host a web application with Azure App service
topItems.excerpt: Create a website in the programming language of your choice through the hosted web app platform in Azure App Service.

value.title: AZ-104: Configure and manage virtual networks for Azure administrators
value.excerpt: Learn how to configure key Azure network capabilities and prepare for Exam AZ-104: Microsoft Azure Administrator.

topItems.title: Configure the network for your virtual machines
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to connect your local on-premises networks into Azure using virtual networks, VPN gateways, and Azure ExpressRoute.

topItems.title: Design an IP addressing schema for your Azure deployment
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you will learn how to plan and implement an IP addressing scheme for virtual networks and virtual machines in Azure.

topItems.title: Distribute your services across Azure virtual networks and integrate them by using virtual network peering
topItems.excerpt: Use virtual network peering to enable communication across virtual networks in a way that's secure and minimally complex.

topItems.title: Secure and isolate access to Azure resources by using network security groups and service endpoints
topItems.excerpt: Find out how Azure network security groups and service endpoints help you secure your virtual machines and Azure services from unauthorized network access.

value.title: AZ-400: Define and implement continuous integration
value.excerpt: Create automated pipelines that continuously build, test, and deploy your applications and prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Create a build pipeline with Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Set up a continuous integration (CI) pipeline that automates the process of building your application.

topItems.title: Run quality tests in your build pipeline by using Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Find out about automated testing that proves your code to be maintainable, understandable, and functioning without repetitive manual testing.

topItems.title: Manage build dependencies with Azure Artifacts
topItems.excerpt: In this module, the Space Game web team guides you through creating a build pipeline that produces a package that can be used by multiple applications.

topItems.title: Host your own build agent in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Work with guidance from the Space Game web team to set up your build agent running on-premises or on an Azure virtual machine running in the cloud.

value.title: AZ-400: Develop a Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) strategy
value.excerpt: Sustainably achieve the appropriate level of reliability in your systems, services, and products and prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Introduction to Site Reliability Engineering (SRE)
topItems.excerpt: Learn about SRE, an engineering discipline that helps you sustainably achieve the appropriate level of reliability in your systems, services, and products.

topItems.title: Improve incident response with alerting on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Respond to incidents and activities in your infrastructure through alerting capabilities in Azure Monitor.

topItems.title: Capture Web Application Logs with App Service Diagnostics Logging
topItems.excerpt: Learn about how to capture trace output from your Azure web apps. View a live log stream and download logs files for offline analysis.

topItems.title: Manage site reliability
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to manage site reliability.

value.title: Build AI solutions with Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: Azure Machine Learning is a cloud platform for training, deploying, managing, and monitoring machine learning models. Learn how to use the Azure Machine Learning Python SDK to create enterprise-ready machine learning solutions.

topItems.title: Introduction to the Azure Machine Learning SDK
topItems.excerpt: Azure Machine Learning provides a cloud-based platform for training, deploying, and managing machine learning models.

topItems.title: Train a machine learning model with Azure Machine Learning
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use Azure Machine Learning to train a model and register it in a workspace.

topItems.title: Work with Data in Azure Machine Learning
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to work with datastores and datasets in Azure Machine Learning.

topItems.title: Work with Compute in Azure Machine Learning
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to manage compute contexts for experiments in Azure Machine Learning.

value.title: Build applications with Azure DevOps
value.excerpt: In this learning path, find out how to collaborate with others to continuously build, test, and verify your applications using Azure Pipelines and GitHub.

topItems.title: Create a build pipeline with Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Set up a continuous integration (CI) pipeline that automates the process of building your application.

topItems.title: Implement a code workflow in your build pipeline by using Git and GitHub
topItems.excerpt: Learn along with the Space Game web team the benefits of collaboration through Visual Studio Code and GitHub.

topItems.title: Run quality tests in your build pipeline by using Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Find out about automated testing that proves your code to be maintainable, understandable, and functioning without repetitive manual testing.

topItems.title: Scan open source components for vulnerabilities and license ratings in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Scan open-source components for security vulnerabilities and assess their license ratings when your application builds in Azure Pipelines.

value.title: Build great solutions with the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework
value.excerpt: Learn how to design and build secure, scalable, high-performing solutions in Azure using the pillars of the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework.

topItems.title: Introduction to the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework
topItems.excerpt: Learn how using key principles throughout your cloud architecture can help you design and build a solid architectural foundation that you can continuously improve.

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Cost optimization
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use the cost optimization pillar of the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework to design a cloud-based architecture that is efficient, eliminates waste, and gives you full visibility into where your money is spent on cloud resources.

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Operational excellence
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to design an Azure architecture that uses modern practices and gives you full visibility into what's happening in your environment.

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Performance efficiency
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to adjust your capacity based on workload and how to optimize network performance, storage, and database performance.

value.title: Configure and manage virtual networks for Azure administrators
value.excerpt: Learn how to configure and manage key Azure network capabilities.

topItems.title: Configure the network for your virtual machines
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to connect your local on-premises networks into Azure using virtual networks, VPN gateways, and Azure ExpressRoute.

topItems.title: Design an IP addressing schema for your Azure deployment
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you will learn how to plan and implement an IP addressing scheme for virtual networks and virtual machines in Azure.

topItems.title: Distribute your services across Azure virtual networks and integrate them by using virtual network peering
topItems.excerpt: Use virtual network peering to enable communication across virtual networks in a way that's secure and minimally complex.

topItems.title: Secure and isolate access to Azure resources by using network security groups and service endpoints
topItems.excerpt: Find out how Azure network security groups and service endpoints help you secure your virtual machines and Azure services from unauthorized network access.

value.title: Deliver remote desktops and apps from Azure with Windows Virtual Desktop
value.excerpt: Windows Virtual Desktop on Microsoft Azure is a desktop and app virtualization service that runs on the cloud. Windows Virtual Desktop works across devices – including Windows, Mac, iOS, and Android – with full-featured apps that you can use to access remote desktops and apps.

topItems.title: Introduction to Windows Virtual Desktop in Microsoft Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use Windows Virtual Desktop to deliver remote desktop and remote app experiences in Microsoft Azure.

topItems.title: Prepare for Windows Virtual Desktop in Microsoft Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to prepare for Windows Virtual Desktop - a cloud-based virtualization solution running on Microsoft Azure. Windows Virtual Desktop is an elastically scalable service to deliver remote desktop and remote app experiences - without having to manage the underlying server infrastructure. Review the prerequisites and tools provided by Microsoft get ready to provision your first Windows Virtual Desktop host pool.

topItems.title: Deploy Windows Virtual Desktop in Microsoft Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to deploy Windows Virtual Desktop and customize the workspace for your users.

topItems.title: Optimize Windows Virtual Desktop in Microsoft Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn the steps to optimize Windows Virtual Desktop, including how to take advantage of new storage, file management, and automated scaling options.

value.title: Explore computer vision in Microsoft Azure
value.excerpt: Computer vision is an area of artificial intelligence (AI) in which software systems are designed to perceive the world visually, though cameras, images, and video. There are multiple specific types of computer vision problem that AI engineers and data scientists can solve using a mix of custom machine learning models and platform-as-a-service (PaaS) solutions - including many cognitive services in Microsoft Azure.

topItems.title: Analyze images with the Computer Vision service
topItems.excerpt: The Computer Vision service enables software engineers to create intelligent solutions that extract information from images; a common task in many artificial intelligence (AI) scenarios.

topItems.title: Classify images with the Custom Vision service
topItems.excerpt: Image classification is a common workload in artificial intelligence (AI) applications. It harnesses the predictive power of machine learning to enable AI systems to identify real-world items based on images.

topItems.title: Detect objects in images with the Custom Vision service
topItems.excerpt: Object detection is a form of computer vision in which artificial intelligence (AI) agents can identify and locate specific types of object in an image or camera feed.

topItems.title: Detect and analyze faces with the Face service
topItems.excerpt: Face detection, analysis, and recognition is an important capability for artificial intelligence (AI) solutions. The Face cognitive service in Azure makes it easy integrate these capabilities into your applications.

value.title: Implement network security in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to configure, protect, and isolate your networks in Azure.

topItems.title: Security, responsibility, and trust in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Discuss the basic concepts for protecting your infrastructure and data when you work in the cloud. Understand what responsibilities are yours and what Azure takes care of for you.

topItems.title: Configure the network for your virtual machines
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to connect your local on-premises networks into Azure using virtual networks, VPN gateways, and Azure ExpressRoute.

topItems.title: Secure and isolate access to Azure resources by using network security groups and service endpoints
topItems.excerpt: Find out how Azure network security groups and service endpoints help you secure your virtual machines and Azure services from unauthorized network access.

topItems.title: Encrypt network traffic end to end with Azure Application Gateway
topItems.excerpt: Secure the traffic from your users all the way to your web servers by enabling TLS encryption on Application Gateway.

value.title: Improve your reliability with modern operations practices
value.excerpt: The reliability of your systems, services and products has a direct impact on your success. Learn the modern operations principles and practices (and the Azure features that support them) that will help you achieve the level of reliability you need.

topItems.title: Improve your reliability with modern operations practices: An introduction
topItems.excerpt: Discover a map for navigating reliability challenges and sustainably achieving the appropriate level of reliability in your systems, services, and products.

topItems.title: Improve your reliability with modern operations practices: Monitoring
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use monitoring to help you sustainably achieve the appropriate level of reliability in your systems, services, and products.

topItems.title: Improve your reliability with modern operations practices: Incident response
topItems.excerpt: Learn the incident response fundamentals necessary to help you sustainably achieve the appropriate level of reliability in your systems, services, and products.

topItems.title: Improve your reliability with modern operations practices: Learning from failure
topItems.excerpt: Learn about post-incident reviews, a practice necessary to help you sustainably achieve the appropriate level of reliability in your systems, services, and products.

value.title: Introduction to Azure IoT
value.excerpt: Follow this learning path for a broad and compelling introduction to the fundamentals of building IoT solutions with Azure IoT.

topItems.title: Enabling digital transformation
topItems.excerpt: Digital transformation is a wave of business innovation fueled by the explosion of technology—data, applications, and devices are everywhere. The cloud, artificial intelligence (AI), and the internet of things (IoT) give organizations new ways to make sense of information and generate insights to transform their business. Realizing the benefits of digital transformation requires business leaders to look beyond technology to reimagine existing business models and embrace a different way of bringing together people, data, and processes to create value for customers.

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure IoT strategy and solutions
topItems.excerpt: This module provides an overview of Azure IoT, and describes Microsoft tools, services, and infrastructure. This knowledge can help bring IoT to life for your organization and customers.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure IoT Hub
topItems.excerpt: University of Oxford

topItems.title: Learn how to manage IoT devices as an IT admin
topItems.excerpt: This module is an introduction to the Internet of Things for IT admins.

value.title: Manage security operations in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to configure security policies and manage security alerts with the tools and services in Azure.

topItems.title: Security, responsibility, and trust in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Discuss the basic concepts for protecting your infrastructure and data when you work in the cloud. Understand what responsibilities are yours and what Azure takes care of for you.

topItems.title: Create security baselines
topItems.excerpt: Create security baselines

topItems.title: Identify security threats with Azure Security Center
topItems.excerpt: Master securing your Azure workloads with Azure Security Center. In this module, you’ll discover how to detect and respond to threats with Azure Security Center.

topItems.title: Resolve security threats with Azure Security Center
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you’ll use the alert capabilities of Azure Security Center to watch for and respond to threats.

value.title: Migrate application workloads and data to Azure
value.excerpt: Migrate application workloads and data to Azure

topItems.title: Design your migration to Azure
topItems.excerpt: Minimize the time and resources required to migrate your on-premises environment to Azure. Assess your current systems with Azure Migrate, and migrate them with Azure Migrate and Azure Database Migration Service.

topItems.title: Prepare on-premises workloads for migration to Azure
topItems.excerpt: Prepare on-premises workloads for migration to Azure

topItems.title: Migrate on-premises workloads to Azure
topItems.excerpt: Migrate on-premises workloads to Azure

topItems.title: Migrate your relational data stored in SQL Server to Azure SQL Database
topItems.excerpt: Plan and implement the migration of relational data from SQL Server to Azure SQL Database. Select the appropriate migration strategy for your database, and then use Data Migration Assistant to do the assessment and the migration.

value.title: SAP certified offerings for Azure
value.excerpt: As an IT Professional experienced in SAP solutions, you need to learn about how to leverage Azure resources that include virtual machines, virtual networks, storage accounts, and Azure AD. These modules will give you the Azure knowledge around SAP Workloads, the certified offerings in Azure, and how to utilize IAAS support for your SAP workloads.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure for SAP workloads
topItems.excerpt: With the recently expanded partnership between Microsoft and SAP, you can run SAP applications across development, test, and production scenarios in Azure, taking advantage of the scalability, flexibility, and cost savings of Microsoft Azure.

topItems.title: Deploy SAP certified offerings on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Azure provides a scalable, compliant, and enterprise-proven platform for a range of SAP workloads. In this module, you explore the platform compliance criteria that is stipulated by SAP before deploying SAP solutions in Azure, and look at the different options for deploying SAP in Azure.

topItems.title: Using IAAS support with Azure for SAP workloads
topItems.excerpt: There are a variety of commonly used SAP-certified operating systems supported by SAP running on Azure VMs, and there are also several different methods of provisioning storage for SAP workloads in Azure. In this module, you will learn the SAP recommended support products and VM types as well as the network, database, and monitoring requirements.

topItems.title: SAP HANA on Azure Compute, Network, and Storage
topItems.excerpt: AP HANA on Azure (Large Instances) provides virtual machines for deploying and running SAP HANA. This module explores the SAP HANA on Azure (Large Instances) solution that builds on assigned, non -shared host/server bare -metal hardware.

value.title: Securely connect IoT devices to the cloud
value.excerpt: Follow this learning path to learn how to securely connect IoT devices with Azure IoT.

topItems.title: Learn how to manage IoT devices as an IT admin
topItems.excerpt: This module is an introduction to the Internet of Things for IT admins.

topItems.title: Automatically provision IoT devices securely and at scale with the Device Provisioning Service
topItems.excerpt: The focus of this module is on creating a Device Provisioning Service (DPS) to securely handle multiple remote devices. First, you create an IoT Hub, and add the DPS service. Next, an X.509 root certificate, and multiple leaf certificates, are created to handle security. Code for a simulated device is provided. You then link all the pieces together, and verify that your DPS resource works. After completing the module, you should have a good understanding of how to provision Azure IoT devices at scale.

topItems.title: Identify anomalies by routing data via IoT Hub to a built-in ML model in Azure Stream Analytics
topItems.excerpt: Learn about Azure IoT Hub message routing, and Stream Analytics anomaly detection. Start by creating an app that simulates issues with conveyor belt vibration. Then, use the Azure portal to route all the data for archiving in blob storage. Finish by routing the vibration data to anomaly detection, using a built-in ML model.

topItems.title: Remotely monitor and control devices with Azure IoT Hub
topItems.excerpt: Create an IoT Hub device app, and a back-end service app. As a scenario, we use the monitoring, and controlling, of the temperature and humidity of a cheese cave.
